column2: review

I rarely give 5 stars. This restaurant reserved it. What a gem of a restaurant. Feeling very lucky to have found it among thousands of reataurants in Surat. Even though I rarely get to dine outside in Surat but this easily the best so far. The food was tasty - European but with a punch of Indian flavor. Was served by Kartik from shiliguri. He was excellent and as I write this review, I am feeling happy with full tummy. I ordered the lamb roast as main and it did not disappoint  me.
Plan to come back again if o get the chance. The surprising part was the menu which was sitting on the table looking like a newspaper - pleasant surprise. üòÄ
Thanks to the owners for creating such a place for us to enjoy.

This was my second visit to trezoro.. the most loved are pizzas and desserts of Trezoro.. they are a must try.. we ordered pesto sauce pizza which was chef special pizza, mock-tails containing cranberry mojito and pineapple mango sorbet both were not impressive also prices were high according to the taste so overall 4 star to food. We also tried guacamole sourdough toast which was tasty again portion size was very small..in desserts we tried classic Tiramisu which was absolute delight.. overall food was great but mocktails were not upto mark..

The food served here is pathetic. There are egg shells in the food and any one knows what it can do. The valet parking guy dose not respond a car comes and we park ourselves and he is busy using his phone. When we say the coffee is made wrong the manager tells us hum toh aisa hi banate hai apko nahi pata hoga. The food portions are too small for some articles that it cant even feed a baby. We came here to have a good breakfast but we‚Äôre so disappointed that we wont recommend any one coming here. They served us a sandwich which was fridge cold. This is the worst service and food we have had.

Very bad experience, staff does not have serving etiquette, ordered pizza which was not up to the mark, almost soggy
When we tried to explain the manager instead of acknowledging our opinion he was stuck to his opinion how bad pizza they can make.
Won't come again here.

One of the best places for breakfast or brunch in Surat. The food quality is exceptional, with an extensive menu offering a wide variety of options. I had a fantastic time here. The staff is warm and attentive, and the service is truly top-notch.

Cool breeze drink was not like described. But still nice as a subtle drink

Passion ice tea was nice

Lamb burger was not up to expectations as a fine dine rest. Vegetables need to be cut thinner and smaller

Pasta was good

Taco starters was nice

Staff was very polite understanding.

Can also play board games.

Over all nice experience worth a try 8/10

It's a great looking place with a perfect cafe ambience. They have created a good fine dining experience. But the food was very under par. They don't know how to make italian food. They are very overpriced for the quality of food they are serving. I would not recommend this place. This pizza that I have uploaded was not worth finishing also.

If you worship food, then you must visit this place. Your taste buds will be on cloud nine after trying treasures from the menu.  The taste is not usual, it‚Äôs no where near to what you eat everyday so take a first bite with an open mind, I am sure that you will fall in love with the whole experience. I was fortunate enough to meet and chat with owners. They have prepared/created each and every item in the menu which can be felt in minute details in the preparation of the food. I was blown away by the fact that they grow some of the ingredients in house, do not forget to ask about these home grown ingredients. The ambience of the place is welcoming for whole family, group of friends as well as for couples on their first date. Eat whatever you like, you will enjoy it but don‚Äôt miss the rose tart‚Ä¶. Any time of the day and any day of the week is perfect to visit this place. Parking is not a problem as they have valet parking.
Overall food is too costly with compare to Similar restaurants..and taste was also not that up to the mark‚Ä¶location is good ‚Ä¶Place need maintenance and cleanliness‚Ä¶

This restaurant came in highly recommended by a local resident.
Great place for some casual dining & a good place to chill with friends & family.

The truffle fries were great, Pesto chicken pizza & the original margarita pizza were good!

Fried chicken wings were good too‚Ä¶

The soups were average & spaghetti pasta was OK!

Overall 5 stays for food & ambiance‚Ä¶

The customer service could have been a bit better. Especially related to the way The food was served‚Ä¶.
Instead of starting appetizers and soup first they served a pizza first, and then got the rest of the food randomly‚Ä¶
But overall decent service.

We met the two owners at the end of our meal and they were very personable and appreciated our visit and candid feedback.

Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant if you‚Äôre visiting Surat‚Ä¶

Trezoro is a must-visit destination in Surat for anyone seeking an exceptional Italian dining experience. The prawn risotto is an absolute highlight, perfectly creamy and bursting with flavor, while their chicken dishes are expertly cooked, tender, and seasoned to perfection. For vegetarians, the menu offers an array of delicious options, ensuring everyone finds something to savor.

The ambiance is just as impressive as the food. Set in a beautifully designed space, the interiors blend earthy tones, reclaimed wood, and greenery to create a warm and inviting atmosphere. Whether it‚Äôs a casual outing or a special occasion, Trezoro delivers an unforgettable dining experience with attentive service and a great vibe. Highly recommended!

Vibe of the place-great but the food is not that great.
The tiramisu croissant was a bummer coz it did not taste anything like tiramisu - too bitter and fully loaded with coffee poweder and cream
Tiramisu and croissant are the two things I love and when merged I expected something great but it wasn't.

The pizza was a bit different then routine and I personally liked it but my friends didn't as they found it similar to naan and chicken curry.

Hot chocolate had a thick layer of MALAAI on top of it...I had never seen one on top of a hot chocolate, normally seen on top of milk and tea when it boils and cools down.

Ordered a sandwich as well and it was fine.

Hazelnut shake was good

Trezoro has a welcoming vibe and the food didn‚Äôt disappoint. I tried the Mexican Tomato Soup, a bit cold but was flavorful with a nice warmth, and the Vegetable Lasagne, which was comforting and well‚Äëmade. The portions were generous and the ingredients tasted fresh.

One area for improvement would be the atmosphere. Adding some light background music could help elevate the dining experience and make the space feel more lively.

Overall, a solid pick for a tasty, satisfying meal with potential for a nicer ambiance.

Good place to hang out with friends..vintage and aesthetic ambience..great bakery and dessert options. Also, food little expensive but good in taste. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Most of the food items are inspired by Italian food.

For those who are not fond of Italian food, this is not the place for them.  Those who are interested in exploring new food can enjoy visiting here once.

Yesterday we visited this place. They have such a unique concept of menu. We ordered so many varieties from their menu. Like we tried Napoli whispering pizza üçï which was damnn good but the sauces served with it ..it guess it was same like marinara sauce it was good but the after taste was tingling on tongue. After that we ordered gnocchi but they didn't have it. So we ordered Fuseli Alfredo which was normal. Then we ordered a filet fish burger but again they didn't have it. So we ordered a grill shroom burger. It was really good like the patty and stuffing but the sauce eewww it was really overpowering. They said it is animal sauce but TBH it tasted something similar like mustard sauce. That made the taste of burger from wow to zero in seconds. We ordered pineapple kombucha which was like of 10days. we didn't like it much. Again we ordered pistachio caramel milkshake which was damn delicious. Then lastly we ordered salted caramel eclair but it felt stale. like the texture and even the taste you can tell it. The sauce and the chocolate didn't go well together. The flavour was bad. French cuisine is not worth it here ig. Italian was good üëçüèΩ

For every Non-Veg lover, you should be coming and trying here definitely! Each and every dish crafted with utmost care and the taste is justtt beyond what you will expect, do try it and it will be the best place that you would visitüëçüèªüëçüèª

Good place to hang out..vintage and aesthetic ambience..great bakery and dessert options. Also, food little expensive but good in taste. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. You can host workshops, dinners etc.

Trezoro is a charming caf√© with a delightful European vibe, perfect for a cozy outing. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with mood lighting and cute decor that adds to its charm.

The menu at Trezoro is impressive, offering a wide range of delicacies like pastries, cookies, breads, pizzas, and coffee. It‚Äôs a great spot for a first date, with a unique touch‚Äîicebreakers and conversation topics listed on the menu to help get things started.

We ordered the Truffle Treasure, one of the best Neapolitan pizzas I‚Äôve ever had. The combination of caramelized onions, marinara sauce, Mozzarella and Parmesan cheese, and cooked mushrooms topped with truffle oil was a classic delight.

To drink, I had the Vietnamese Cold Coffee, which was a balanced mix of espresso shots and condensed milk‚Äînot too sweet, just right. We also tried the Belgian Chocolate Milkshake, which was very, very good. It's on the sweeter side, so it‚Äôs perfect if you have a sweet tooth.

The service was quick and professional, with polite staff who made the experience even better.

Our final bill for two people came to Rs 1,536.

There is free valet parking available for four wheeler and ample parking space for two wheelers

"If you have a subpar product, market it as 'unique.'"

I made a regrettable decision to visit Trezoro for dessert with my family. We arrived around 10:45 PM on 06/07/2024 and ordered a hazelnut frappe coffee, hazelnut cheesecake, and a chocolate pastry.

Things were fine until we tasted the star dish of the night, the ‚ÄúChocolate Pastry‚Äù...

The chocolate pastry was so stale that even the chocolate tasted sour. I called a staff member over to complain and received one of the strangest responses: ‚ÄúSir, the beauty of Trezoro is that everything here is served differently.‚Äù I had to assertively explain that I ordered a simple chocolate pastry, I have visited many places, and chocolate should never taste sour unless there's an issue. After persistent complaints, he finally agreed to check the pastry and, by the grace of God, confessed that the pastry was indeed stale.

Here's the saddest part. They pulled out the magic wand that almost all eateries do: they refused to give me the bill and started arguing that they couldn't charge me because their service didn't meet my expectations. Here are my observations:

1. Every customer is not a freeloader. They come to your establishment to have a good time and are prepared to pay for it. Instead of making them feel like freeloaders, provide the dining experience they seek.
2. By waiving the bill, they incurred multiple losses. They lost the food cost to prepare the items. Only one dish had an issue, so they could have removed that item from the bill. They didn‚Äôt because it wasn‚Äôt coming out of their (staff‚Äôs) pocket.
3. They inadvertently promoted a freeloading culture by implying that one could argue about the food or service to get free items.
4. They lost a potential returning customer due to unnecessary arguments at multiple points.

Nothing is perfect, but that doesn't mean feedback should be ignored or easy escape routes should be taken when faults are found.

My only takeaway from yesterday‚Äôs visit is that I now have to convince my young child, who loves chocolate pastries, that not all chocolate pastries are bad.

It‚Äôs mix veg and non veg restaurant

French fries - 4/5

Truffle treasure pizza - 5/5 must try

Napolis whispering pesto pizza - 5/5 must try

Zesty berry pilaf - 5/5

Panner steak - 4/5

Roasted  vegetables lasagna - 5/5

Broccoli and truffle herb rice - 3/5

Farm house pizza - 5/5

Cottage cheese burger - 5/5
Trezoro: A hidden gem in Surat! The Spaghetti Farmhouse was incredible, and the Tiramisu was to die for. The ambiance is perfect for a romantic evening. Don't miss this fantastic Italian restaurant!

Nestled in the heart of the city, this charming cafe is a hidden gem that captivates both locals and visitors alike. From the moment you step inside, the warm ambiance and inviting aroma of freshly baked cookies envelop you in a comforting embrace. The attentive staff members, with their genuine smiles, add a personal touch to your dining experience.

The menu boasts an impressive array of culinary delights, from artisanal pastries to hearty brunch options. Each dish is a masterpiece, carefully crafted with a perfect balance of flavors and presented with an artistic flair. Whether you're a coffee connoisseur or simply seeking a delightful meal, the expertly brewed beverages and delectable treats here are sure to satisfy your cravings.

The attention to detail extends to the decor, creating an atmosphere that effortlessly blends vintage charm with contemporary elegance. The cozy corners and stylish furnishings invite you to linger, making it an ideal spot for both intimate conversations and solitary contemplation.

In conclusion, It's more than a place to enjoy a meal; it's an immersive experience that leaves you with a lingering sense of contentment and a desire to return.

They have prepared/created each and every item in the menu which can be felt in minute details in the preparation of the food.
I was blown away by the fact that they grow some of the ingredients in house, do not forget to ask about these home grown ingredients. The ambience of the place is welcoming for whole family, group of friends as well as for couples on their first date. Eat whatever you like, you will enjoy it but don‚Äôt miss the rose tart‚Ä¶.
Any time of the day and any day of the week is perfect to visit this place. Parking is not a problem as they have valet parking.

If you‚Äôre looking for a delightful cafe experience in the Piplod area, Trezoro Cafe is an absolute must-visit. From the moment you step in, you‚Äôre welcomed by an excellent ambiance that perfectly blends modern chic with cozy comfort. The decor is stylish yet inviting, making it an ideal spot for anything from a casual coffee date to a more formal gathering.

The food at Trezoro Cafe is nothing short of exceptional. Each dish is crafted with care and precision, offering a burst of flavors that will leave your taste buds craving for more. A standout item on their menu is the Nutella Croissant. This delectable treat is a perfect blend of flaky pastry and rich Nutella, making it an irresistible choice for anyone with a sweet tooth.

Overall, Trezoro Cafe excels in both ambiance and culinary offerings. Whether you‚Äôre a local or just passing through Piplod, this cafe is definitely worth a visit.

We visited this place for lunch and had an amazing experience!

‚ú® Starters: We started with Peri Peri French Fries and they were absolutely delicious! üî•

üçï Main Course: We ordered the Cottage Cheese Nepolian Pizza, and I must say, it was next-level! The thin crust was perfectly crisp, and the flavors were just incredible. Along with that, we tried the Green Onion Mac & Cheese Pasta, which was super creamy and flavorful.

üç∞ Desserts: The highlight of our meal was the Tiramisu‚Äîone of the best I‚Äôve had in Surat! We also tried the **Dark Chocolate Raspberry Pull Me Up Dessert**, and it was simply divine. A must-try for chocolate lovers! üç´üòç

üçπ Drinks: The Cranberry Mojito was super refreshing and had the perfect balance of flavors.

‚ú® Ambience & Pricing: The vibe of the place is amazing, and though the cost is slightly higher than other cafes, it's totally worth it! Highly recommend visiting with your loved ones. ‚ù§Ô∏è

#FoodieAdventures #MustTry #SuratEats #PizzaLover #Foodgasm #DeliciousBites #CafeVibes #FoodReview
Very beautiful place, Food is good too. I must say they have created very good atmosphere and very friendly & suggestive staff.

I visited Trezero recently to celebrate a special birthday surprise for my friend. Honestly, I had some expectations since they charged me around ‚Çπ1000 for the decoration, but it didn‚Äôt really feel worth it.

The decoration included only rose petals, used candles, and a few battery-operated candles. For the price, I was expecting something more thoughtful and creative. It looked decent, but not special.

As for the food ‚Äì the dessert was the best part of the evening. The pizza was okay, but the nachos and garlic bread didn‚Äôt taste fresh or flavorful. I really feel the food could‚Äôve been better, especially for a celebration setup.

Another thing I noticed was the staff constantly looking at us while we were enjoying our moment. It made us feel a little uncomfortable, as if we were being watched the whole time. Really not the experience we expected.

Beautiful place with lovely decor and lovelier food! It's quite nice to visit places in Surat with great options that aren't strictly vegetarian. We had the Chicken Tacos, Calabrese Paneer Canapes, Shroom Bombs and the Truffle Treasure Neopolitan Pizza. For desserts, we had the Coconut & Mango Panna Cotta and Tiramisu Cookie. We also tried the Full Bloom & Brazilian Lemonade Beverages. The Brazilian Lemonade is super refreshing and a must dry if you like sour drinks! All of these were really great, and the portion sizes of all, especially the pizza, was excellent. The bakery also has lovely macrons and eclairs. Both are the best I've had in Surat so far!
Would definitely love to visit Trezoro again soon!

Trezoro Cafe, the first thing that struck me was the warm and inviting ambiance üòç. The decor is a perfect blend of modern and rustic, with comfortable seating options for both individuals and groups. Whether you're looking for a cozy corner to work in or a place to catch up with friendsüíë, Trezoro has you covered.
.
.
Trezoro Cafe in Piplod is a true culinary treasure. From the inviting ambiance to the mouthwatering food and exceptional service, it offers an all-around fantastic dining experience. Whether you're a local resident or just passing through, I highly recommend paying a visit to Trezoro. You won't be disappointed.

This cafe has quickly become a personal favorite, and I can't wait to return to explore more of their menu offerings. Kudos to the team at Trezoro for creating such a wonderful dining destination in Piplod.
This is must Visit Place for Non Veg Lovers. We had Lamb Lasagna Half And Half Two types of Chicken Pizza and A Mocktail. The service was Superb. Ambiance was all to gather different  and Pleasing.

While the caf√© impresses with its chic ambiance, the culinary experience leaves much to be desired. I ordered the red sauce pasta, requesting it to be spicy and cheesy. What arrived was underwhelming-tangy to the point of imbalance (70% tangy, 30% mildly spicy), with no trace of the promised cheesiness. The tomatoes were noticeably half-cooked, lending an unpleasant texture.

Portion size was another disappointment- barely enough to fill a medium bowl. Considering the steep pricing, the meal offered poor value both in taste and quantity. A visually appealing space cannot mask the lack of attention to flavor and execution.

The ambiance is so good. You can go with your loved ones. You can chill with friends and family. The food taste is just amazing. The food presentation is so good. Fine crockery, lift is available if you have senior citizens with you. The overall experience is amazing. You must try their Pistachio ice cream. It's so delicious üòãü§§.

From South Africa, loved the lamb burger! Must try! From service to food all was
Amazing! Thank you to Kartik!

Aside from their main meals- their coffee and desserts are to die for! I returned for seconds!

I visited Trezoro today with high expectations- thought of it being very professional and unlike other Surat cafes.
However, my experience wasn‚Äôt that great- the ambiance no doubt is amazing! But the service and food is really average and overpriced tbvh.
I ordered butter garlic chicken and Pesto pasta. The portion was meager. Not enough for 3 people.
On top of that the chicken was really oily and salty.
Last but not least the waiting time was just too long. We waited for more than 30 minutes for pasta to arrive and after 15 minutes our second dish arrived ( it‚Äôs around 1 PM when there wasnt any rush)
Also the parking guy wasn‚Äôt available at that time.
This is my honest review- no hate to them but please keep these points in mind when going there.

I went there with family today. Overall experience was not bad. But it could have been better.

Their menu is designed to look like a news paper. I liked that novelty. The choices were also unique. I wish more places go towards being authentic than pleasing every one.

We ordered nachos as appetizers, veg burger for the kids, mushroom stroganoff for the missus and I to share and Komboucha for me and Mojito for the missus to drink.

Drinks were served first. They did not have classic Komboucha so I had to order flavoured Ginger and thyme Komboucha. It wasn't bad either, but I prefer the classic one. It was a little bit too sour, but still better than any other place I have tried in Surat. When I brew it at home, I do not let mine get that sour.

Then they brought the nachos. Kids found them too hot (spicy) so I asked the server for melted cheese on the side so that they could dip it to mellow. The server said cheese on the side is chargeable. I was taken aback because it was not a road side food truck but a fine dine restaurant. Since when such requests need the servers to announce to guests if something is chargeable? I was ok with the charges so they then brought a small bowl of melted cheese for my kids. They did not charge us in the end for this so I assume that staff member previously worked at a cheaper restaurant and isn't trained well.

Then they brought our main dishes. Mushroom stroganoff was really good. All of us enjoyed it. Even my daughter who is not a big fan of mushrooms, ate part of it.

The burger was served with fries, but they had some kind of spice sprinkled on it. Again, we requested to replace our spiced fries for plain fries for kids' sake. The manager questioned why we did not inform them at the time of placing the order that we did not want our fries spiced. Well, yes we missed that but they saw the kids with us and could have enquired as this could not be the first time they had this issue. My wife was frustrated by their accusatory tone and replied in kind. I was ok to pay extra for plain fries. They were nice enough to bring plane fries without an extra charge finally. The buns were soggy and my kids did not eat it. We ate a little but left it as it was too soggy for us too. This is also one of the factors why my kids liked the mushroom dish.

Our total bill was about 2200, which is not that expensive but they could do better with their service.

Awesome place to have breakfast.
Make sure to visit early on empty stomach!

Guacamole Burrata Sourdough is must! With fresh juices!

Ek dum #1! Love the rooftop access and room for private parties. Able to host large gatherings and fresh tasty offerings from the talented chefs in the kitchen. Don‚Äôt forget to try the amazing desserts!!!

Not worth the hype.  Didn't liked the dining experience at all. Not recommended at all.

Overpriced and items were not upto the mark.

We ordered paneer steak, tuscan cauliflower,  veg lasagne,  crossiants and kambucha.

Didnt liked anything except paneer steak. Worst experience üò™

A cozy cafe with delicious food, friendly staff, and a welcoming ambience. The service is attentive, the menu is well-crafted, and the atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for relaxing or catching up with friends. Highly recommended!
I just landed in Surat yesterday and I found a gem here!
Qiest a good one. Ambience was quiet unique.  & roof top area was really aesthetic. Food was yummy & service was also good.

Fantastic spread of menu, cosy ambience and delicious food,
Definitely worth a few more visits

So tangy that it might as well have been stale and bad! Lasagna was like a bread at the centre floating in marinara sauce, eating lasagna felt like chewing mulch ‚Ä¶ Chipotle sauce felt like buttermilk ‚Ä¶ i don‚Äôt know if everything else is good but anything with chipotle sauce and especially lasgna GOD NO! Definitely not worth the money..
Excellent place in surat! To visit! If u are look for an amazing ambiance! N a peaceful place to have food with ur loved ones it is apt! I loved everything here!
This place went beyond our expectations, I could dedicate a whole visit to this place just for it's desserts. I highly recommend it's hot chocolate and koreon potato sandwich.
Some how I felt the quality of garlic was bad. Maybe you can try peeling the garlic inhouse for better flavour. Rest the dessert was very good.

Trezoro Cafe, located in the heart of Piplod has a very warm and inviting ambiance üòç. The decor is a perfect blend of modern and rustic, with comfortable seating options for both individuals and groups. Whether you're looking for a cozy corner to work in or a place to catch up with friendsüíë, Trezoro has you covered.

We ordered Basil and Tomato Pizza & Calabrese and Paneer Canape with an Affogato. Must say the pizza was so mouth watering and was amazingly cooked. I wouldn't recommend Canape as it tasted very okayish.

Overall the dining experience with the food and service was decent enough. Would definitely suggest to try the cuisine once.
Good food with asthetic ambience good quantity of food. Overall good
Good environment, food is also good, like the creative newspaper style menu, but my order was too late. Try to focus on that... Overall it was good experience
One of the most magnificent cafe I've visited  ever. The staff is also very kind and friendly. Would love to visit again for some delights üòä
Food and vibes are amazing. Their Nutella cake is the best. The service is quick.

I didn't I the place interior and food

1990/- for 2 shakes and 1 sandwich and 1 pizza
And the worst part is we ask for best pizza so basically there best is worst and only pizza cost 900/- for nothing
Cheese on pizza is like curd (dhai)
If anybody want to eat something there then don't go there

Prepare to embark on a sensory journey at Trezoro, where exquisite interior design and delectable cuisine converge to create an unparalleled dining experience.

The moment you step inside, the ambiance of Trezoro captivates with its tasteful decor. From cozy corners adorned with plush furnishings to the enchanting play of warm and cool tones, every detail contributes to an atmosphere that is both chic and inviting. The thoughtful use of natural light adds a touch of warmth, making it an ideal spot for both intimate conversations and solo reflection.

The menu at Trezoro is a culinary masterpiece, boasting a diverse range of dishes that cater to various palates. The fusion of flavors and creative presentation elevate each dish to a gastronomic delight. The attention to quality ingredients is evident, making every bite a celebration of taste.

The staff's passion for food is matched only by their commitment to exceptional service. They navigate the menu with ease, offering insightful recommendations and ensuring a seamless dining experience. The personalized touch creates an atmosphere that goes beyond mere customer service ‚Äì it feels like a welcoming extension of home.

The coffee and dessert selections deserve a special mention, as they elevate the overall dining experience. From artisanal brews to decadent pastries, Trezoro has mastered the art of satisfying even the most discerning sweet tooth.

In conclusion, Trezoro is not just a cafe; it's an immersive journey for the senses. Whether you're a food connoisseur or someone seeking a haven of aesthetic delight, this cafe seamlessly blends style and flavor to create an experience that lingers long after you've left.
Awesome experience and amazing ambience. Loved the food and the hospitality of the staff.
Went for their Sunday breakfast. If you want to try something else than usual, you can definitely visit.
I loved the food, especially the Neopolitan pizza. The staff were super helpful and endearing. The music was rocking. A rock-solid dining place.
The cafe offered excellent service, a pleasant ambiance, and a variety of amenities. The menu stood out with unique dishes that were hard to find elsewhere in Surat.

Bobby bhai fed us like family and it turned into a fulfilling day for us..
Majaa aavi gai guys ü•Ç

One of the best places in Surat with a graceful, minimalist interior. Color palettes used are beautiful!
Food is served fresh and of the highest quality. Staff is very polite. It is a must visit place of Surat!
Staff is very polite. Food is very authentic and well cooked. Would love to visit again!

Trezoro: a treasure box filled with the most exquisite gems curated by ‚Äòsa-sha‚Äô. It has a very aesthetic and cozy ambience, a delicious and unique taste, and comforting services. Basically, it‚Äôs a mini Europe with homely vibes brought to you.
The food is authentic European style. The pepperoni pizza was amazing. Beautiful place, very cute and aesthetic.

Trezoro has become one of those places I keep coming back to ‚Äî and somehow, it always feels a little different in the best way. The Neapolitan pizza is seriously good (that crust!), and their desserts hit the sweet spot without being too heavy. Even the coffee is on point ‚Äî smooth, rich, and clearly made with care. Great vibe, great staff, and just a solid all-round experience every time.

As the name ‚ÄúTrezoro‚Äù itself suggests Treasure in Italian, the ambience, the food and the vibe are treasures unless one experiences it. Trezoro is one of the restaurants which will be known for its uniqueness and sublime dine-in experience. I am certain that people will step in and have a great time.

Best wishes to the wonderful creators, Sagar and Shahaan. Kudos to them for keeping it real. ü§ù

Loved all bakery items. Food is authentic ü´∞üèª
The trezoro team is really friendly and always let customers feel welcomed.
Great food highly recommended only service little bit slow else best european style fine dine
The food was pleasant to eyes but not to the tastebuds!
I love the vibes of this cafe‚Ä¶I really recommend this place‚Ä¶it‚Äôs owner also a kind person‚Ä¶he gave birthday complimentary dessert to my friend
Best service and humble behaviour. Food also have delicious taste but high music volume disturbing to talk each other and headache.
The food was amazing and it was giving authentic taste , and service was so good
Perfect place to have tasty food with good ambience. Suggest to visit once experiencing the best with friendly team.
Had amazing experience! Food and ambience was amazing.

They have awesome and fancy menu available with them, but the issue is few of the food options are not healthy. They have provided the grill food into the deep fry which is quite not good for health. Anyway, this cafe also promotes about healthy food which is quite contradicting as well. We ordered pizza which has the nice taste, the dough was perfect and the crust was well done.

Rest I recommend to improve their menu and food preparation methods

The ambience is good and the atmosphere is also good even though the service is good and fast but honestly not satisfied with the food. Not happy with the food this cafe is only for ambience not for food. This whole cafe have some many photogenic spots but honestly the food is not worth it according to many.
Bobby gave us an excellent service. I truly enjoyed thanks to him. Food came fast and he was attentive to all the instructions given. Thank you Bobby!

It is a wonderful cafe/restaurant with a fine dine experience. The cafe spans 3 floors with vintage decor and wabi sabi style serveware. It has excellent cafe experience as it is open at 11:30 am unlike other cafes here in Surat. Specialty coffee with craft croissants and other desserts will make your cafe experience enjoyable. Also the change they gave us for the payment had torn rupee note with a cello tape. After spending 2200 rs for 2 people  one does'nt expect such impolite behaviour.

Trezoro is a gem amongst the plethora of restaurants in Surat. With its charming ambiance and delectable menu, it's a must-visit. The restaurant's warm, welcoming staff ensures a delightful dining experience. The diverse menu offers flavors from Italian snacks to European mains, all freshly prepared with precision and creativity. Trezoro's extensive list of baked goods is also something worth looking into. Whether for dinner, special occasion or just a cup of coffee on Wednesday afternoon, Trezoro impresses with its impeccable service and mouthwatering cuisine. An unforgettable dining destination! Must visit

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Trezoro the newest gem in town that promises a delectable journey through the diverse flavors of Europe. From the moment I stepped inside, I was captivated by the warm and inviting ambiance that seamlessly blended with the restaurant‚Äôs European theme.

The menu is a true masterpiece, offering an array of dishes inspired by various European cuisines. Each dish seemed to tell a story of its origin, and the attention to detail was impeccable. I started my culinary adventure with the flat bread  appetizer, a delightful blend of caramelised onion , sundried tomatoes and olive oil atop perfectly .that transported me straight to the heart of Italy.

To end my culinary journey, I indulged in a Belgian hot chocolate that was pure decadence. The smooth texture and rich chocolate flavor were a fitting finale to an exceptional meal.

Whether you‚Äôre a culinary explorer or simply seeking an unforgettable dining experience, I wholeheartedly recommend Trezoro It‚Äôs a delightful destination that transports your taste buds across Europe‚Äôs rich culinary landscape. Make a reservation and prepare to be amazed!

I recently visited this rooftop restaurant and had a lovely experience. The ambience is one of its biggest highlights ‚Äì open, breezy, and perfectly giving that ‚Äúroof-top vibe‚Äù you‚Äôd expect for a relaxed outing.

The staff here truly adds to the experience. They‚Äôre warm, approachable, and quite efficient. A special mention to Sachin, who attended our table so attentively and made sure we were well taken care of.

Food-wise, the menu is pretty extensive ‚Äì from Punjabi and Chinese to Mexican starters, you‚Äôll find plenty of options to choose from. The taste is satisfying, and the prices are fair compared to other restaurants in the area.

One small drawback is the ordering process ‚Äì while they provide a QR code menu, you can‚Äôt directly place an order through it, which feels a little inconvenient.

That said, overall, it‚Äôs a great place to spend time with friends or family. On weekends you might face a short wait, but otherwise it‚Äôs fairly relaxed and uncrowded. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre looking for good food paired with a chilled-out rooftop setting.

It‚Äôs a missed opportunity. The restaurant is situated on terrace of a commercial building, so the designer had a very good chance to provide a very good view to every table but it‚Äôs quite opposite to that. Food quality is not bad but does not justify the price as well. I ordered Level 5 special soup and chef special sabji. Both the items  were eatable but there was nothing special about it. Laccha parathas was really cooked well and not chewy. The worst part was the loud music which was not matching the ambiance.

Great restaurant with good food and nice vibes. I ordered Mexican Garden Sizzler and Veg Crispy. Both were very tasty. I am a non-vegetarian but did not miss chicken at all üòâ. The only drawback is that the food is a bit pricey and the restaurant needs a powerful central AC.

Levvel 5 Restaurant features an open layout with bamboo partitions and subdued lighting, creating a decent ambience.

While the service is average, the food stands out, offering both vegetarian and Jain options.
The lighting wasn‚Äôt that great but the staff was friendly.

The pi√±a colada was enjoyable, though it could have been improved. Although the portion sizes were small, dishes like the tacos and veg crispy were delicious and had a satisfying crunch.

This restaurant is rooftop restaurant with a good ambience. The staff is super friendly and offers a quick service.

You might find some wait time over the weekend otherwise there isn't much crowd here.

There are plenty of food options available ranging from Punjabi, Chinese, Mexican starters etc

The ordering experience is a bit off, as even after having a QR based menu you cannot order from the website.

But overall the food is decent and tasty, pricing also is at par with other restaurants around.

The ambience is really good. It gives an apt roof top vibe. The food is really good. The service is excellent, especially Sachin who attended us.

Must try is their sizzlers. Mexican Sizzler and Italian Volcano is what I tried ( pictures below) were really good.

Overall worth visiting.

Our dinner experience was delightful, marked by a positive overall impression. Opting for a mocktail and the Mexican Garden Sizzler, we were pleased with the flavors that tantalized our taste buds. The culinary journey was a success, as the dishes lived up to our expectations.

The ambiance of the establishment added to the enjoyment of our evening. A well-crafted atmosphere accompanied by good service enhanced our dining experience. The staff was attentive and ensured our needs were met, contributing to the overall positive impression.

However, the only hiccup in an otherwise smooth evening was a bit of a rush, possibly attributed to the ongoing festival season. During peak hours, waiting downstairs became a necessity. While this added a minor inconvenience, it didn't overshadow the positive aspects of the evening.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at LEVEL 5 restaurant, and the experience left a lasting impression. With its elegant ambiance, delectable cuisine, and attentive service, it's undoubtedly a standout dining destination.

The restaurant's modern yet inviting decor immediately set the tone for a memorable evening. The attention to detail in the design created a chic and comfortable atmosphere, perfect for both intimate dinners and celebratory gatherings.

The culinary journey at LEVEL 5 was nothing short of exceptional. The menu showcased a fusion of flavors, offering a diverse range of dishes that catered to various palates. Each dish was thoughtfully crafted with a harmonious blend of ingredients, and the presentation was a visual delight.

The standout for me was the impeccable service. The staff exhibited a genuine passion for their work, ensuring that every aspect of the dining experience was seamless. Their knowledge of the menu, wine pairings, and willingness to accommodate dietary preferences truly elevated the evening.

Although the majority of my experience was superb, there were a couple of minor lapses in timing between courses. However, this did not significantly impact the overall experience.

In conclusion, LEVEL 5 restaurant is an exquisite culinary haven that delivers on all fronts. From the sophisticated decor and mouthwatering cuisine to the attentive service, it offers an experience that's worth savoring. I highly recommend LEVEL 5 for those seeking a memorable dining experience that transcends ordinary expectations.

Visited this place in my hometown with Family on last Saturday Night. Was amazed to see such a lovely place opening up within my locality. Great Ambiance, Cabin/hut like structure. You get a bell in each one if you want anything and the waiter will come. And for the non-veggies they server non-veg too. They have got few Candle light seating as well. Also seating option varies on the table or a low height table options.

Downside of being a good place in Surat is there is a long waiting on holidays,  Luckily for us a table of 5 got empty early and we were seated after 10-15 minutes or so.

What we had was some amazing starters, Main course and few Mock-tails. Here's what we tried (Everything Veg :) ).

We started with Manchow Soup, Which was as good as it can get.

Also ordered few mock-tails "Rainy Day",  "Sunset Cooler" & "Tangy Tango". First 2 were kind of sweet, I enjoyed most was "Tangy Tango" and as the name suggest perfectly Tangy. I ended up ordering another one of that.

Tried few starters "Paneer Tikka", "American Cheese Corn Balls",  "Cheese Chilli Toast" and  "Quesadilla". Out of this i really enjoyed Cheese corn balls. Good balance of cheese and corn. Also Cheese Chilli Toast was full of cheese and green Chillis, This was a little spicy so order if you are fan of spice. Paneer Tikka was also great. Quesadilla though might need some improvement, Can't say bad but i have had better (Lol, Just remembered a scene from "Liar Liar"). Would recommend all expect that.

In main course we tried Paneer Sultani and few Roti's. Gravy was superb. I would prefer small pieces of Paneer, So would suggest that if i end up again there and order it again. Though chances of that are slim, Not being there but of ordering the same Main Course :).

By the time we finished all, We were too full to try even a spoon each of Dessert, Probably next time.

Overall very good experience and very happy to see such place opening up in nearby area around my home. Was disappointed that they were not able to accept card that day, Luckily we had cash, But if we didn't it would be an unpleasant situation to be in. So i guess they should make sure to correct this, It's 2017 already.

Also one more thing why your menu is not uploaded on Zomato, Kindly contact Zomato and have it there.

Food quality: The taste, presentation, and overall quality of the food are crucial factors in evaluating a restaurant. Consider the flavors, freshness, and creativity of the dishes served.

Service: The level of attentiveness, friendliness, and efficiency of the staff can greatly impact the dining experience. Prompt service, knowledgeable waitstaff, and a welcoming atmosphere are all desirable qualities.

Ambiance: The atmosphere and ambiance of a restaurant can significantly affect the overall dining experience. Factors like lighting, music, interior design, and overall comfort contribute to the atmosphere.

Cleanliness and hygiene: The cleanliness of the restaurant, including the dining area, restrooms, and food preparation areas, is important for maintaining high standards of hygiene.

Value for money: Assess whether the prices are reasonable in relation to the quality of the food and overall experience. Consider portion sizes, the use of quality ingredients, and any additional services provided.

Consistency: Consistency in food quality, service, and overall experience is vital. A restaurant that consistently delivers a high level of excellence is often more reliable and worthy of recommendation.

My colleagues and I had gone with high hopes to this restaurant, which happened to be our one of the worst dining experiences.

Our order included:
One easily forgettable starter - Cheese corn balls which had a hard and rigid exterior, very unsavory; and a couple of horrendous mains.

One okayish plate of Mexican tacos.

The "Mexican" Garden Sizzler was substandard, with some grilled paneer and veggies, rice and tomato based pasta (pasta being an Italian item).

The lasagna was just some indian pulses stuffed between two pasta sheets. It was the last straw, ruining our appetite and mood completely.

We ordered knowing the taste profile of everything, but it was a disappointment to say the least.

We felt cheated during this dining experience

We went over this place to have surati styled Dosa, they have a decent seating space which is neat n clean and hygienic.

Ordered two flavours of dosas-

Mysore Masala Dosa (it tastes so good that we ordered it twice, so authentic Indian spices flavours and very crisp dosa)

Gini Roll Dosa ( it was lil bit spring roll style, stuffing with a mix taste of bhaaji and pizza toppings - good in flavours and crispiness)

They Serve dosas with unlimited offering of Sambhar, Coconut Chatni and Onion & Tomato Mix Salad.
The add on to this place is their in-house prepared mouth freshener (mukhwaas) sweet and salty at the same time.

Looking forward to visit this place with family.

They have unique flavours of dosa , especially a corn one , we ordered it and it was very tasty , worth trying.

Gives such a cute cozy french vibe. The playlist is on point. I was never a fan of croissants until i tried the Chicken Salami Croissant. It's the only place that serves chicken salami croissant in town. And i loved it. If you're okay with experimenting with different kinds of coffee, ask the head Barista to make you something new. He experiments a lot, and happens to make the best. If you're in the mood to have a Frappe, ask for something new, and he'll make the best. If you're just into coffee, try Picolo. Strong and one of the best. Hits right. Absolutely love love love the vibe.

He experiments a lot, and happens to make the best. If you're in the mood to have a Frappe, ask for something new, and he'll make the best. If you're just into coffee, try Picolo.
